Adult.description: In flight adult Red-legged Kittiwakes have gray under the primaries, whereas Black-legged Kittiwakes have white.

Immature.description: Immature Red-legged Kittiwakes have a darker spot behind the eye and a darker gray back than Black-legged Kittiwakes.

Nonbreeding adult.description: In flight, adult Bonaparte's Gulls can be separated from Black-legged Kittiwakes by the white leading edge of the wing.

First winter.description: In flight, first winter Bonaparte's Gulls have a black trailing edge on the wing, whereas Black-legged Kittiwakes of all ages have white trailing edges.

Nonbreeding adult.description: Nonbreeding adult Little Gulls have pale gray wings unlike Black-legged Kittiwakes, which have black wing tips.

First summer.description: First summer Little Gulls lack the immature Black-legged Kittiwake's black collar across the back of the neck.

Juvenile.description: Juvenile Little Gulls could be confused with juvenile Black-legged Kittiwakes, but they lack the black line across the nape that Black-legged Kittiwakes have.

Breeding adult.description: Ross's Gulls have a black bill and paler gray wings and back unlike Black-legged Kittiwakes, which have a yellow bill and darker gray wings and back.

First winter.description: First winter Ross's Gulls have a black M on their back like juvenile Black-legged Kittiwakes, but they lack the Black-legged Kittiwake's black collar.

Breeding adult (American).description: Short-billed Gulls are much larger with a longer neck and heavier body than Black-legged Kittiwakes.
